YouTube user Elman511 cracked open an over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens. He found a standard-sized egg inside, along with yolk and white. The unusual occurrence is down to a counter-peristalsis contraction. This is when a second oocyte is released by the hen's ovary before the first egg has completely traveled through the oviduct. The second oocyte is released, and the first is in the eggshell-gland portion of the oviduct.

For the first time in 65 years the California Department of Water Resources has found no snow during its manual survey of the land at 6,800 feet in the Sierra Nevada in early April. The fourth consecutive year of vanishing snow spells trouble as California depends on it to melt into rivers and replenish replenish reservoirs. The governor's order requires cities and towns to cut water use by 25 percent.

Greenstone is a small egg-shaped gadget that acts like a beacon, or a beacon. It helps messages move around the so-called wireless mesh networks. It uses a feature that launched in iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework. It creates a wireless mesh network that connects phones to each other. It lets users users send messages to people in close proximity that are in Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct. But there are limits to how far a message can travel in this way.

A University of Nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you. Limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol. The new recipe also doesn't use maltodextrin, which McDonald's said is generally used as a sugar to increase browning or as a carrier for seasoning.

Researchers in Tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears and narrow their eyes when they are in pain. They also puff up their cheeks when they are in pain. To test the rodents' response to rats' pained expressions, they showed them the photos in a specially made cage. They found that rats spent less time in the room showing rodents in pain than they did in the other compartment showing rats with neutral expressions.

There were at least three reports of people trying to release gopher tortoises in the ocean because they were mistaken for sea turtles. The Florida Wildlife Commission said that one can tell the difference between a sea turtles and a tortoise by looking at the animal's feet. Gopher tortoises have toes with claws on each toe and sea turtles have flippers with just one or two claws on each.

Spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration. Until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast Spain. But then the climate warmed to 13°C (55°F) and became more humid. This enabled hominins - the distant ancestors. - to move to new regions. And it is believed that the earliest humans were able to move to the Mediterranean Sea.

Deep water gas hydrates in the Arctic are reservoirs for abiotic methane. The gas forms through a process called serpentinisation. It occurs when seawater reacts with hot mantle rocks exhumed along large faults within the seafloor. The reservoirs are secure, and scientists don't believe they will impact climate change.

Identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, but it's impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from. Identical twins start life with the same genes because they come from the same fertilised egg. But as they age age different life experiences create variations in the number of hydrogen bonds in the DNA. The Grimes Cottage is one of the oldest surviving homes in the Sydney Harbourside suburb of Millers Point. The home was built by whaling captain George Grimes who constructed a row of early 1840s terraces depicted in artist Conrad Marten's work in 1843. The 416sqm inner city block property has a large northerly garden with footsteps down to the heart of the historic area of The Rocks. The property has a formal lounge and dining room with original fireplaces, high ceilings and an open-plan kitchen.

The 99-7% accurate BioSure HIV Self Test enables people to test themselves when. An estimated 26,000 people in the UK have HIV but are unaware of it. The kit uses a small amount of blood from a finger-prick sample to detect the presence of HIV antibodies. It gives a result in just 15 minutes.
Currently mobile phone companies charge up to 20p a minute to dial free 0800 numbers. The charges will end from July 1 under proposals published by the telecoms watchdog. EE claims the move will make an already struggling industry suffer.

The men will be given white clothing to wear and blindfolded. They will be led from their isolated cells in Batu prison through the wildly dense tropical forest.
